content: back of the leg note always work the back stitches of the cables as the stitches need to be for the next round if you changed to larger needles for the leg switch back at the start of the heel flap heel flap this time the flap is worked like a standard top down heel flap back and forth over half the stitches this heel will be on the same needle s as the toe up heel all slipped stitches are slipped purl-wise with the yarn held to the wrong side of the sock heel flap set up round 1 working the stitches as they appear work ribbing stopping 1 stitch before bor work half of a 1x1 cable as follows slip the last stitch of the round to a cable needle and hold in front remove and reserve the bor marker knit the first stitch of the round slip the stitch from the cable needle back to the left needle and do not work heel flap set up row 2 ws turn slip the first stitch work the ribbing as it presents across 30 32 34 stitches slip the next stitch to a cable needle and hold to the back remove and reserve the mor marker purl the next stitch put the held stitch as the last stitch of the instep on hold with the instep stitches row 3 rs turn slip the first stitch work the stitches as presented ending with a k1 k2 k1 row 4 ws turn slip the first stitch work the stitches as presented ending with a p1 p2 p1 repeat row 3 and 4 until there are 16 17 18 slipped stitches on the left side there will be one less slipped stitch on the right side total of 32 34 36 row heel turn here the short row are worked from the shortest to the longest remember to when knitting the ds work both legs of the ds together set up row 1 rs turn work slip the first stitch work ribbing as set until there are 8 stitches left on the flap set up row 2 ws turn make ds purl until there are 8 stitches left row 3 rs turn make ds knit to ds on the other side knit ds k1 row 4 ws turn make ds purl to ds on the other side purl ds p1 repeat row 3 and 4 until there is 1 unworked stitch on each side 8 dss will have been worked on one side and 7 on the other conjoined sock twins v6 0 ©2025 katherine richmond rinaradish 7 of 12 gusset pick up for gussets the gusset stitches will be picked up and worked purl-wise to keep the nice v line down the side of the heel flap matching the toe up side this is achieved as follows with the right side facing and the yarn in front insert the working needle from the back through the heel flap between the edge
